text:
Our project requires the use of the -id (user id) PCLI Parameter to access 
repositories across shared databases. We need ant to get and build files from 
the pvcs shared repository. 
Please let me know if this parameter can be added to the existing ANT 
application. 
The existing command line used by ANT:
pcli lvf -z -aw -pr\\i1d2pvcs\pvcsprod  /BTOBase

The command line that works:
pcli lvf -z -aw -idMike -pr\\i1d2pvcs\pvcsprod /BTOBase

This -id parameter can be provided as an optional parameter

Thanks
Banu A Parasuraman
creator: banup@yahoo.com

text:
Created attachment 800
patch to add -id option to pcli command line if UserID is set
creator: snewton@io.com

text:
I'm at home so I can't test this at the moment but the above patch should do the
right thing.  It adds a UserID property to the Pvcs tasks and will modify the
pcli command line appropriately if it is set.
creator: snewton@io.com

text:
Pathc applied to CVS on 02-02-02.  Will you please check to make sure I haven't
broken anything?  Thanks!
creator: umagesh@apache.org
